content.text: This specification defines a comprehensive type system and formal semantics for safety-critical concurrent systems. The STRATUM framework provides:

items: **Formal Foundations (§1-6)**: Type system, abstract syntax, well-formedness, and seven guarantees (G1-G7)
**Operations & Profiles (§7-9)**: Query operations, domain profiles, and extension mechanisms
**Formal Theory (§10-27)**: Theorems, concurrency semantics, compositional properties, certification artifacts, and safety integration
**Implementation Support (§11, §17-18)**: Reference implementation, proof templates, and language checklists
**Safety Standards (§17-18, §26-29)**: DO-178C/DO-330 compliance, ISO 26262 coverage, STPA/FMEA integration, and cross-standard traceability
**Type Soundness (Theorem 10.1)**: Well-typed programs cannot reach undefined states
**Progress (Theorem 10.2)**: Non-stuck evaluation for all well-formed definitions
**Preservation (Theorem 10.3)**: Type safety maintained across reduction steps
**GC Correctness (Theorem 17.1-17.3)**: Garbage collection preserves observable semantics

content.text:
STRATUM provides formal evidence for:
- Safety claim verification (ISO 26262 ASIL A-D)
- Functional safety compliance (IEC 61508 SIL 1-4)
- Assurance case support through mechanized proofs
- Tool qualification evidence for language implementations

The specification is organized in six logical parts:
- **PART I: Foundations** (§1-6): Core type system, abstract syntax, well-formedness, guarantees, inference rules
- **PART II: Operations** (§7-9): Query operations, domain profiles, extension mechanisms
- **PART III: Formal Theory** (§10, §13-14, §16, §21-24, §28, §30): Theorems, proofs, concurrency, temporal properties, attenuation
- **PART IV: Implementation** (§11, §19-20): Reference implementation, proof templates, checklists
- **PART V: Certification** (§17-18, §26-27, §29): Certification artifacts, tool qualification, coverage matrices, STPA/FMEA, traceability
- **PART VI: Appendices** (§12, §31, §32): Summary, glossary, bibliography
